alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Susquehanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 11:14AM EST until February 19 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Otsego County in central New York... Broome County in central New York... Northwestern Delaware County in central New York... Southeastern Tioga County in central New York... Southern Chenango County in central New York... Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Bradford County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Wyoming County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 1215 PM EST. * At 1114 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Norwich to Canton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Binghamton, Vestal, Johnson City, Endicott, Kirkwood, Conklin, Maine, Rush, Sidney and Guilford. This includes the following highway exits... New York Interstate 81 between 1 and 6. Interstate 86/Route 17 between 65 and 84. Interstate 88 between 1 and 12. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 219 and 230. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
